I think Western people have a fundamental misunderstanding of Bishounen as a concept...

Sylas, Yasuo and Sett aren't Bishounen.

Well Bishōnen literally means beautiful boy so all depends on what people themselves find to be beautiful in some cases.

They are young, but eh... To me, Kayn and Sylas as definitely not attractive.

It specifically refers to youthful and even somewhat feminine boys.
Older teens to young adults are often considered Bishounen because they have less Masculine appearances than their older counterparts.
In Japan where these ideologies originate, the epitome of a Bishounen would be a somewhat handsome younger male with softer features and smoother skin.  Not yet tainted by work or the like.  

Contrary to what you may think it's very objective.  Ezreal is Bishounen, Sylas is not.  Similarly this is why Taric will likely never recieve a Star Guardian skin.  He might be attractive- but he is most _definitely_ not a Bishounen.

Bishounen literally means pretty boy. It's very vague in that right and can go with a lot. Just like Bishojou is Pretty girl.

Maybe not to you but some of them most definitely are. Plus skins are also something controlled by demand, and Taric hasn't had one since his PP skin and SG is a theme people want him in badly. Rakan is far from being a beautiful or feminine boy and yet he's there..

It's also funny how you say any of this when Im pretty sure you're the one that made an SG kayn pic. There's absolutely no way he'd have one. Also wasn't this whole thread about someone like Sett being in a band with Ezreal? They would want them to have similarities in order for them to work well in a group like that. So it's odd that you say he isn't one. Feels like a double standard.

Despite the vague sounding meaning, it's a much more narrow classification.  It doesn't go by Western standards and is only opinion based on borderline cases.  Most characters either are or are not Bishonen, no ifs ands or buts.

Rakan isn't a Bishonen, and he got in as the Best Friend type.
The same role Jayce takes in Battle Academia.

Sett isn't Bishonen, but he is, again, the Best Friend type.

In standard works you have a Bishonen protagonist and a cool guy Best Friend type.

And for the record, Kayn is _far_ more likely to get a Star Guardian skin than Taric.  Because he A. Fits into it better, and B. offers a much more interesting story set up of someone fighting against the darkness.
Keep in mind the Star Guardians all go to High School, Taric doesn't look anything like a High Schooler.  It's entirely possible he might become a Purple Guardian.
